intro: Hieracium avjovarrense, commonly known as the Alaskan hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, rocky, or sandy soils and is adapted to cold climates. It has basal leaves that are often hairy and can reach up to 20 cm in height. Hieracium avjovarrense is an important component of alpine and tundra ecosystems, contributing to soil stabilization and providing nectar for pollinators.
